news_header: Crude oil prices fell further, reaching a one-month low as U.S. production increases and rising inventories put pressure on the market.
news_original_title: Oil Prices See Further Downside As Trump Reiterates Pledge To Boost Production
news_text: Crude oil prices continued to decline on Thursday, dropping to a one-month low of $70.61 per barrel after a significant decrease the previous day. This decline was influenced by President Trump's commitment to boost U.S. oil production and a stronger U.S. dollar. Additionally, a report indicated a sharp rise in U.S. crude oil inventories, which increased by 8.7 million barrels last week, surpassing economists' expectations.
